DataElement.preferredName: Immunology Cytokine Panel 12 MAFD Assay Concentration in picograms per Milliliter
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The study of the body's immune system._An assay to detect the presence and level of 12 cytokines in a blood sample (IFN gamma, IL1 beta, IL10, IL12, IL13, IL2, IL2R, IL4, IL5, IL6, IL8, TNF alpha)._A method for simultaneous detection of multiple target molecules. It utilizes specific antibodies for the analytes of interest coupled to fluorescent polystyrol beads. After conjugation of the captured analyte to the bead, the beads are differentiated by their size and their spectral signature, allowing quantitation of analyte concentration in the sample._The determination of the amount of a particular constituent of a mixture or of the biological or pharmacological potency of a drug._A numeric represention of the concentration of a solution expressed as number of picograms per milliliter.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Immunology Cytokine Panel 12 Multi-Analyte Fluorescent Detection Assay
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The study of the body's immune system._An assay to detect the presence and level of 12 cytokines in a blood sample (IFN gamma, IL1 beta, IL10, IL12, IL13, IL2, IL2R, IL4, IL5, IL6, IL8, TNF alpha)._A method for simultaneous detection of multiple target molecules. It utilizes specific antibodies for the analytes of interest coupled to fluorescent polystyrol beads. After conjugation of the captured analyte to the bead, the beads are differentiated by their size and their spectral signature, allowing quantitation of analyte concentration in the sample._The determination of the amount of a particular constituent of a mixture or of the biological or pharmacological potency of a drug.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The study of the body's immune system.

Concepts.definition: The study of the immune system and its reaction to pathogens, as well as its malfunctions (autoimmune diseases, allergies, rejection of organ transplants).

Property.preferredName: Cytokine Panel 12 Multi-Analyte Fluorescent Detection Assay
Property.preferredDefinition: An assay to detect the presence and level of 12 cytokines in a blood sample (IFN gamma, IL1 beta, IL10, IL12, IL13, IL2, IL2R, IL4, IL5, IL6, IL8, TNF alpha).:A method for simultaneous detection of multiple target molecules. It utilizes specific antibodies for the analytes of interest coupled to fluorescent polystyrol beads. After conjugation of the captured analyte to the bead, the beads are differentiated by their size and their spectral signature, allowing quantitation of analyte concentration in the sample.:The determination of the amount of a particular constituent of a mixture or of the biological or pharmacological potency of a drug.

Concepts.definition: An assay to detect the presence and level of 12 cytokines in a blood sample (IFN gamma, IL1 beta, IL10, IL12, IL13, IL2, IL2R, IL4, IL5, IL6, IL8, TNF alpha).

A method for simultaneous detection of multiple target molecules. It utilizes specific antibodies for the analytes of interest coupled to fluorescent polystyrol beads. After conjugation of the captured analyte to the bead, the beads are differentiated by their size and their spectral signature, allowing quantitation of analyte concentration in the sample.
A qualitative or quantitative analysis performed to determine the amount of a particular constituent in a sample or the biological or pharmacological properties of a drug.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numeric represention of the concentration of a solution expressed as number of picograms per milliliter.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A measure of the amount of substance present in a unit amount of mixture, particularly, the amount of solute dissolved in a solvent. The amounts can be expressed as moles, masses, volumes, or parts.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: The quantity of a substance per unit volume or weight; a measure of the amount of substance present in a unit amount of mixture, particularly, the amount of solute dissolved in a solvent. The amounts can be expressed as moles, masses, volumes, or parts.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21

ReferenceDocuments.name: A bioassay to measure 12 diff
ReferenceDocuments.description: A bioassay to measure 12 different cytokines: IFN gamma, IL-1 beta, IL-10, IL-12, IL-13, IL-2, IL-2R, IL-4, IL-5, IL-6, IL-8, TNF alpha.

DataElement.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21
